writer.name: 哈尼莱恩·乔·阿利皮奥 Honeylyn Joy Alipio

introduction: Embroiled in a legal battle against a powerful figure, a deaf boy, with the support of his parents, cross paths with a court sign language interpreter who can speak but is voiceless in her own home.Lucas, a deaf boy from a small fishing village, is sexually abused by Fr. Mejor, an influential priest. After his parents Madonna and Dante discover the truth, they decide to file a court case against the priest despite the obstacles in their way. In their pursuit of justice, they cross paths with sign language interpreter Maya, who has also witnessed powerful people manipulate the results of cases. In a society where few choose to listen, how can they win against forces that silence those who cannot speak and break the souls of those who can?
